intro: Melochia trujilloi, commonly known as the Trujillo melochia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador, and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically large and lobed, and its showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Melochia trujilloi is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral display.
